===Etymology 1===
[[File:Pouring_liquid_mercury_bionerd.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|汞}} (''mizugane''): [[mercury]].]]
{{ja-kanjitab|みずがね|yomi=k}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=みずがね|水|tr1=mizu|t1=water|銀|tr2=kane|t2=metal, silver}}. {{rendaku2|sort=みずがね|kane|gane}}

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|みずがね}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|みずがね|hhira=みづがね}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=みずがね|chemistry|rare|obsolete}} {{alternative spelling of|水銀|lang=ja}}: {{l|en|mercury}}, {{l|en|quicksilver}}

=====Usage notes=====
The term ''mizugane'', regardless of kanji spelling, is largely obsolete in modern Japanese.

The usage of this kanji is extremely rare, and it is not used in isolation in modern Japanese. Use {{l|ja|水銀}} instead for the standalone word for {{m|en|mercury}}.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|こう|yomi=o}}

# {{l|en|mercury}}, {{l|en|quicksilver}}

=====Usage notes=====
